adjective.description: Consisting of or involving three parts, things, or people.

predeterminer.description: Three times as much or as many.
examples: the copper energy cells had triple the efficiency of silicon cells

noun.description: A thing that is three times as large as usual or is made up of three standard units or items.
A sporting contest in which each side has three players.
A system of change ringing using seven bells, with three pairs changing places each time.
A hit which enables the batter to reach third base.

verb.description: Become three times as much or as many.
examples: grain prices were expected to triple

origin: Middle English (as an adjective and adverb): from Old French, or from Latin triplus, from Greek triplous.
